intro: Chaetospora albescens, commonly known as the white-spored lichen, is a species of lichen that belongs to the family Caloplacaceae. It is characterized by its pale yellow to white thallus, which is typically crustose in growth form. The plant forms a symbiotic relationship between a fungus and an alga or cyanobacterium, which provides it with the ability to photosynthesize. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, often found on bark or soil surfaces in temperate regions. Its reproductive structures, known as soredia, are dispersed by wind, aiding in its spread across suitable habitats.
